articles.content:
Twenty-one persons deprived of liberty (PDLs) at the Sablayan Prison and Penal Farm (SPPF) in Occidental Mindoro have asked President Marcos to grant them executive clemency.

articles.content:

articles.title: World Brain Tumour Day 2025: What your health insurance covers and what it doesn’t
articles.description: While standard health insurance policies typically include brain tumour treatments, gaps in coverage and high out-of-pocket expenses remain concerns.
articles.content: On World Brain Tumour Day 2025, industry experts have highlighted the increasing financial burden of treating brain tumours and the vital role of health insurance in covering associated costs. While standard health insurance policies typically includ... [2542 chars]

articles.title: Trump seizes opportunity to deploy federal force in California
articles.description: Presidents usually roll out the National Guard in consultation with state governors. Not this time.
articles.content:
The tension on the streets of Los Angeles reflects a widening gulf between California's political leaders and the federal government.
The state's Democratic governor, Gavin Newsom, accused the White House of "sowing chaos" as "an excuse to escalate".... [1496 chars]

articles.title: 'This is my mum, she’s travelling’: Woman sends mother’s ashes to sea in bottle, but it comes back
articles.description: Cara Melia honoured her late mum’s wish to travel by sending her ashes out to sea in a bottle, hoping it would reach far-off lands. The touching tribute quickly went viral after the bottle returned.
articles.content:
In a touching tribute, 24-year-old Cara Melia from Oldham, UK, has captured hearts online after honouring her late mother’s dream of travelling the world—by setting her ashes adrift at sea in a glass bottle.
Her mother, Wendy Chadwick, passed away at... [1606 chars]
